summary: The Commercial Motor Vehicle English Proficiency Act amends Title 49 of the United States Code concerning commercial motor vehicle operator testing. It mandates that individuals demonstrate English proficiency to pass knowledge tests and receive certifications. This includes understanding traffic signs, communicating with officials, and providing/receiving directions in English. Knowledge tests cannot be administered in any language other than English, effective two years post-enactment. The Secretary of Transportation is tasked with modifying existing regulations to implement these changes.
